PROGRAMMES AVAILABLE AT THE NATIONAL DIPLOMA (ND) AND ENTRY REQUIREMENTS   
POLYTECHNIC/COURSE  COURSE REQUIREMENTS  UTME SUBJECTS  REMARKS/WAIVER  
 FEDPO-EDE      
 FEDPO-FFA      
FEDPO-IDA      
FEDPO-ILA      
FEDPOMUB    
 FEDPO-NAM       
 FEDPO-NAS      
 FEDPO-NEK      
FEDPO-OKO  FEDPO-UKA  
FIDEIPOLY    
HERITAGE

RUGIPO  
  f) FEDPOFFA does not accept Biology/Agricultural 
Science.  
g) OSUNTECH same as in Building Technology.  
h) FIDEI and KAD -POLY require ‘O’ level pass in 
English Language and ‘O’ level credit passes in 
Mathematics, Physics or Chemistry and two (2) of 
Economics, Technical Drawing/Art, Chemistry, 
Geography, Woodwork, Biology, Building 
Construction or Religious Know ledge as course 
requirement. It requires Mathematics, Physics and 
any one (1) of Economics, Geography or 
Chemistry as UTME subjects.  
i) OZORO Same as Agric Engineering.  
j) FEDPO-BID requires Physics/Chemistry, 
Mathematics and English Language.  
k) PLS-POLY requir es ‘O’ level credit passes in 
English Language, Mathematics, Physics and any 
one (1) of chemistry, Biology/Agricultural Science, 
Geography, Economics, Technical Drawing.  
l) KWAPOLY accepts five (5) credit passes in 
Biology/Agricultural Science, Building 
Construction, Brick Laying/Block Laying, 
Concreting, Walls/Floor, Ceiling Finishing, Joinery, 
Carpentry, Gas/Steam Work and Bronze Welding, 
Cold and Hot Water Supply, Sanitation and 
Drainage.  
m) RUGIPO requires a pass in English Language.  
n) FEDPO-EDE requires fiv e (5) ‘O’ Level Credit 
passes in English Language, Mathematics, 
Physics and any two (2) of the following: 
Economics, Technical Drawing/Fine Art, 
Chemistry, Geography, Further Mathematics,  
Woodwork, Biology, Building Construction  
o) FEDPO-AIU requires five (5) ‘O’ level credit passes 
to include English Language,  
Mathematics, Physics or Chemistry and any two 
(2) of the following Economics, Geography, 
Biology, technical drawing and Agricultural 
Science.  
p) FEDPO-ILA requires three (3) ‘O ’ level credit 
passes in Physics, Mathematics, Geography, 
Economics, Biology/Agric. Science as the UTME 
subjects.
